ovdesc.p: The purpose of the Account Accrual table is to provide the system with information at Company level about how and when to process Accruals of interest and charges on Customer Accounts and whether interest capitalisation is inclusive or exclusive of the balance on capitalisation date, the value dates of interest entries generated and the day on which the entries are booked.
Interest Accruals may be processed daily or monthly. or it could be specified that no accrual is to be made. Account charges may only be processed at calendar month end.

The periodicity of interest accrual could be specified at Account Group or Category Level for different Currency types (foreign or local). For Accounts not covered by specified definition, default interest accrual periodicity could be defined based on Account Currency type.
Dates for interest capitalisation are specified at group level in the Group Capitalisation table and for specific Accounts in the Account Capitalisation table.

desc.p: Optional input.
YES indicates that the information only ACCR.ACCT.XX for accounts accruals are written out.
Where XX indicates DR, DR2, CR, CR2, and CH
NO or null indicattes that the records are not written.
NB: The INFO.ACCT.XX application can be used to view accrual information for an individual account.
Introduced in G14.0.0.
Specifies the Currency Type (Foreign, Local or Both) of the Accounts.
Mandatory field.
Field associated with the field DEFLT.ACCR.FQU.
Valid values are BOTH, FOREIGN, LOCAL.
Duplicates not allowed.
BOTH could not be specified either with FOREIGN or LOCAL.
If either FOREIGN or LOCAL is specified, then a second value of either LOCAL or FOREIGN respectively, is mandatory.

If the value is NONE, then interest would not be accrued.
Mandatory field, if value is specified in ACCRUAL.CAT.
Field associated with the fields ACCRUAL.CAT and CATEG.TYPE.

Introduced in G14.0.0.

If the value is NONE, then interest would not be accrued.
Mandatory field, if value is specified in ACCRUAL.GRP.

Identifies a local routine that can be called to adjust the compensation account data.
This routine will be called with 1 multi valued argument delimited by field marks.
The argument data is as follows:-
Field 1 - the lead acount number i.e. the account being compensated to, this is for information only
Field 2 - the start date of the calculation period, this can be adjusted if required
Field 3 - The end date of the calculation period, this is for information only

Field 4 - Indicates the type of processing taking palce, and is information only, "S" = capitalisation, "A" = accrual, "C" = back value correction, "I" = information only, no accounting entries are posted nb: this can be used via the INFO.ACCT.XX routines for testing purposes where XX indicates the type of interest calculation DR,DR2, CR, CR2, CH
Field 5 - the current list of compensation accounts delimited by value marks marks, this can be adjusted by the local routine

Field6 - associated with field5 this can be returned from the local routine and can contain the start date when the balances for the relevant compensation account in field5 are included in the compensation group balances

Field7 - associated with field5 this can be returned from the local routine and can contain the end date when the balances for the relevant compensation account in field5 are excluded from the compensation group balances
An example follows of how this local routien could be used to adjust the calculation of the compensation group balances.
Acount 100002 was compensated to account 10001 from the second of the month to the tenth of the month.
The calcuation period is the 1st to the 31st of the month.
Account 100002 has a balance of 1000 for the whole period.
Account 100001 has a balance of 2000 for the whole period.
The calculation takes place on the 2nd of the month and is projected to the end of the month.
Normally the compensation group balance will be 3000 for the whole month.
However if the local routine is called the compensation balances can be calculated as follows
nb: the above example will require a local development to store the start and end dates of the compensation group memberships.
Introduced in G14.0.0.
Specifies the Currency Type (Foreign, Local or Both) of the Accounts in the Category specified in ACCRUAL.CAT.
Mandatory if ACCRUAL.CAT is specified.
Field associated with the fields ACCRUAL.CAT and CAT.ACCR.FQU.
Valid values are BOTH, FOREIGN, LOCAL.
Duplicates not allowed.
BOTH could not be specified either with FOREIGN or LOCAL.
If either FOREIGN or LOCAL is specified, then a second value of either LOCAL or FOREIGN respectively, is mandatory.
Can be used to adjust the number of calendar days forward that the value date of an account balance can be adjusted.
For example certain countries require that interest accruals take place on the opening balance of an account rather than the closing balance. Setting this field to 1 will have this effect.
Introduced in G14.0.0.
Specifies the frequency of Interest accrual for the Account types specified in the associated field DEFLT.ACCR.TYPE.
If the value is NONE, then interest would not be accrued.
Mandatory field.
Field associated with the field DEFLT.ACCR.TYPE.
Valid values are DAILY, MONTHLY, NONE.
Specifies whether Account charges are to be accrued every month end, or only booked to Profit and Loss when they are applied.
Account charges may be applied monthly, quarterly or six-monthly as specified in the Company table, always at the end of a calendar month.
Y (Yes), N or NO. (Mandatory input.)
This field is for future use, it specifies whether or not Tax calculated in foreign currency should be converted to Local Currency before it is booked to a Tax Account.
Y or N(o) or Nill (Must be NO at present.) (Optional input. No input means Tax is booked in the currency in which it is calculated).
Introduced in G14.0.0.
Specifies the Currency Type (Foreign, Local or Both) of the Accounts in the Group specified in ACCRUAL.GRP.
Mandatory if ACCRUAL.GRP is specified.
Field associated with the fields
ACCRUAL.GRP and GRP.ACCR.FQU.
Valid values are BOTH, FOREIGN, LOCAL.
Duplicates not allowed.
BOTH could not be specified either with FOREIGN or LOCAL.
If either FOREIGN or LOCAL is specified, then a second value of either LOCAL or FOREIGN respectively, is mandatory.
This is the code that defines the Company for which the Accrual information is applicable.
9 type A (alphanumeric) character Company Code OR 2-3 type MNE company mnemonic characters (will be converted to Company Code). (Mandatory input.)
If the Company Code is entered, it must be input as CCGGGNNNN where CC is Country Code GGG is Company Group Code and NNNN is a local number It is always displayed as CC-GGG-NNNN.
If the Company Mnemonic is entered, it is converted and stored as the Company Code.
Specifies the day of the month on which monthly Interest Accrual processes will take place.

If the day specified falls on a non-working day, the Accrual will take place on the previous working day. The accrual calculation will include the month end to date if LAST.DAY.INCLUSIVE is set to Y, otherwise the calculation will not include this date.
1-2 numeric characters in the range 1 to 31. At present only 31 is allowed. Mandatory input. Cannot be changed.
Introduced in G14.0.0.
Specifies the Account Category for which the associated Interest Accrual parameters are defined.
Optional field.
Field associated with the fields CATEG.TYPE and CAT.ACCR.FQU.
Value not allowed if values are defined in the multi-value set of ACCRUAL.GRP.
Should be a valid Customer Account Category in the range 1000 to 9999.
Introduced in G14.0.00.
Specifies the Account Group for which the associated Interest Accrual parameters are defined.
Optional field.
Field associated with the fields GRP.ACCR.TYP and GRP.ACCR.FQU.
Value not allowed if values are defined in the multi-value set of ACCRUAL.CAT.
Should be the ID of a valid record in ACCT.GEN.CONDITION.
Specifies whether interest is to appear on a Customer statement on the date it is calculated or on the following day.

If NEXT is specified, details for producing the interest entries are written in a temporary file. The entries are booked at the start of end-of-day processing on the next working day, by the program IC.POST.NEXT.
The Profit and Loss entries are booked on application (Capitalisation) day, regardless of the contents of this field.
NEXT or TODAY or any abbreviation thereof. (Mandatory input.) Cannot be changed.

Specifies whether the system must automatically raise the accounting transactions to move the IC P&L to xxxxxSP when an account is suspended and then move the xxxxxSP to P&L when the suspense is removed.
If the indicator on ACCT.GROUP.CONDITION is not set, then the indicator on ACCOUNT.ACCRUAL is checked.
Valid Option : 'YES', 'NO' or Null
Specifies whether interest calculations for application are inclusive or exclusive of the capitalisation date.

Assuming MTH.END.UPTO.DAY (field 1) contains 20 and an Account also has Interest Capitalisation on 20th of the month, Monthend Accrual processing and interest application will both take place on the 20th of each month (or on the previous working day if 20th is not a working day).

If this field contains Y, the amount booked to the Customer's Account will include interest calculated on balances with value up to and including 20th. The entry booked to the Account will have a value date of 21st.

If this field contains NO, the amount booked to the Customer's Account will only include interest calculated on balances with value up to and including the last calender day before 20th. The entry booked to the Account will have a value date of the day after the last balance included.
Y (inclusive), N or NO (exclusive). Mandatory input. Cannot be changed once a customer account has been opened in the company.
